008 *******************************************************************************/
009package GeometricOperations;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.image.access.ImageAccessor;
016import imagingbook.common.image.access.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
017import imagingbook.common.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
018
019/**
020 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the use of various pixel
021 * interpolation methods and out-of-bounds strategies.
022 * Simple translation is used as the geometric transformation
023 * (parameters can be specified). Note the use if the
024 * {@link ImageAccessor} class which gives uniform access
025 * to all types of images.
026 * 
027 * @author WB
028 * @version 2015/12/17
029 */
030public class Interpolation_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
031        
032        static InterpolationMethod IPM = InterpolationMethod.Bicubic;
033        static OutOfBoundsStrategy OBS = OutOfBoundsStrategy.NearestBorder;
034        
035        static double dx = 10.50;       // translation parameters
036        static double dy = -3.25;
037        
038        private ImagePlus im;
039        
040    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
041        this.im = im;
042        return DOES_ALL + NO_CHANGES;
043    }
044
045    public void run(ImageProcessor source) {
046        if (!showDialog())
047                        return;
048        
049        final int w = source.getWidth();
050        final int h = source.getHeight();
051        
052        // create the target image (same type as source):
053        ImageProcessor target = source.createProcessor(w, h);
054        
055        // create ImageAccessor's for the source and target  image:
056        ImageAccessor sA = ImageAccessor.create(source, OBS, IPM);
057        ImageAccessor tA = ImageAccessor.create(target);
058        
059        // iterate over all pixels of the target image:
060        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {   // discrete target position (u,v)
061                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
062                        double x = u + dx;      // continuous source position (x,y)
063                        double y = v + dy;
064                        float[] val = sA.getPix(x, y);
065                        tA.setPix(u, v, val);   // update target pixel
066                }
067        }
068        
069        // display the target image:
070        (new ImagePlus(im.getShortTitle() + "-transformed", target)).show();
071    }
072    
073        private boolean showDialog() {
074                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Interpolation demo");
075                gd.addMessage("Translation parameters:");
076                gd.addNumericField("dx", dx, 2);
077                gd.addNumericField("dy", dy, 2);
078                gd.addEnumChoice("Interpolation method", IPM);
079                gd.addEnumChoice("Out-of-bounds strategy", OBS);
080
081                gd.showDialog();
082                if (gd.wasCanceled())
083                        return false;
084                
085                dx = gd.getNextNumber();
086                dy = gd.getNextNumber();
087                IPM = gd.getNextEnumChoice(InterpolationMethod.class);
088                OBS = gd.getNextEnumChoice(OutOfBoundsStrategy.class);
089                return true;
090        }
091}
